intro: Datisca cannabina, commonly known as the stinging nape or wild hemp, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a small, round, green berry that turns red when mature.
